intro: Rhus legatii, commonly known as the Mexican buckthorn, is a small evergreen shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other plants like poison ivy and cashews. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in catkins, followed by red, fleshy berries. Rhus legatii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
